item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-168] Message bounding on subscriptions
item.description: In hedwig, messages for a subscription will queue up forever if the subscriber is offline. In some usecases, this is undesirable, as it will eventually mean resource exhaustion. In this JIRA we propose an optional change to the subscription contract, which allows the user to set a bound on the number of messages which will be queued for its subscription while it is offline.

Summary
-------

In hedwig, messages for a subscription will queue up forever if the subscriber is offline. In some usecases, this is undesirable, as it will eventually mean resource exhaustion. This addresses bug BOOKKEEPER-168.

It seems like 'time' might make a better bound than message count, since message count could be very volatile depending on the topic?

Time based bounding would also be a lot more complex to implement, as it would require a garbage collecting thread, going over each message, checking it against the bound and if so deleting it.

The nice thing about the number based message bound is that it does the cleanup just in time, and it allows administrators to reason about how much storage their system will take without having to worry about tuning garbage collection.
